application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Scots Pine is situated in the front garden of 93 Wiltshire Lane, opposite the entrance and parking area of Haydon School. This tree has a very high amenity value and is a significant and important landscape feature for those living within Wiltshire Lane and Everett Close, as well as for the pupils of Haydon School, who are able to gain view of this tree from different corners of the school. The tree highly contributes to the local biodiversity and makes a significantly positive contribution to the appearance of the local landscape, in unison with the other two protected Scots Pines located nearby. The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the tree is both present and future because it has the potential for long life expectancy.
The applicant is seeking consent to fell and treat this Scots Pine, as the tree is allegedly causing subsidence damage to property 91 Wiltshire Lane.
The information and the scientific and technical evidence provided have been appraised. The leve
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.
description: To fell and treat stump to One Scot's Pine T1 on TPO 453
